pullRequest.body:
Let `R` be a commutative ring and `A` and `B` two `R`-algebras.
- `Subalgebra.centralizer_sup`: if `S` and `T` are subalgebras of `A`, then the centralizer of `S ⊔ T` is the intersection of the centralizer of `S` and the centralizer of `T`.
- `Subalgebra.centralizer_range_includeLeft_eq_center_tensorProduct`: if `B` is free as a module, then the centralizer of `A` in `A ⊗ B` is `C(A) ⊗ B` where `C(A)` is the center of `A`.
- `Subalgebra.centralizer_range_includeRight_eq_center_tensorProduct`: if `A` is free as a module, then the centralizer of `B` in `A ⊗ B` is `A ⊗ C(B)` where `C(B)` is the center of `B`.


---

nodes.body: messageFile.md
messageFile.md
messageFile.md
messageFile.md

Thanks for the PR!

I would call the file `Centralizer.lean` as centers are just special cases of them.
Do you want `AlgEquiv.toAlgHom` or `AlgHomClass.toAlgHom` here?
Good point, I will change it to `(TensorProduct.comm R C D : C ⊗[R] D →ₐ[R] D ⊗[R] C)`
Can you provide the `iSup` and `sSup` versions as well?

I'd only request the `iSup` version as it's easy to use [sSup_eq_iSup'](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Order/CompleteLattice.html#sSup_eq_iSup') when you do encounter `sSup`.
I have added iSup
Are you identifying `Set A` with `A → Prop` here? Not sure if it's just a code smell or should actually be changed
Is this in the right shape to be useable with the induction tactic?
I have changed it slightly so that it now matches `Subgroup.iSup_induction`

Here's a golf that avoids induction:
```suggestion
lemma le_centralizer_iff (S T : Subalgebra R A) : S ≤ centralizer R T ↔ T ≤ centralizer R S :=
  ⟨fun h t ht _ hs ↦ (h hs t ht).symm, fun h s hs _ ht ↦ (h ht s hs).symm⟩

lemma centralizer_sup (S T : Subalgebra R A) :
    centralizer R ((S ⊔ T : Subalgebra R A) : Set A) = centralizer R S ⊓ centralizer R T := by
  refine eq_of_forall_le_iff fun K ↦ ?_
  simp_rw [le_centralizer_iff, sup_le_iff, le_inf_iff, K.le_centralizer_iff]

lemma centralizer_iSup {ι : Sort*} (S : ι → Subalgebra R A) :
    centralizer R ((⨆ i, S i : Subalgebra R A) : Set A) = ⨅ i, centralizer R (S i) := by
  refine eq_of_forall_le_iff fun K ↦ ?_
  simp_rw [le_centralizer_iff, iSup_le_iff, le_iInf_iff, K.le_centralizer_iff]
```

I assume these also work (untested)
```suggestion
lemma centralizer_sup (S T : Subalgebra R A) :
    centralizer R ((S ⊔ T : Subalgebra R A) : Set A) = centralizer R S ⊓ centralizer R T :=
  eq_of_forall_le_iff fun K ↦ by
    simp_rw [le_centralizer_iff, sup_le_iff, le_inf_iff, K.le_centralizer_iff]
lemma centralizer_iSup {ι : Sort*} (S : ι → Subalgebra R A) :
    centralizer R ((⨆ i, S i : Subalgebra R A) : Set A) = ⨅ i, centralizer R (S i) :=
  eq_of_forall_le_iff fun K ↦ by
    simp_rw [le_centralizer_iff, iSup_le_iff, le_iInf_iff, K.le_centralizer_iff]
```
Can you add the version analogous to [`Submodule.iSup_induction'`](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/LinearAlgebra/Span/Basic.html#Submodule.iSup_induction') too?
done

```suggestion
lemma centralizer_coe_sup (S T : Subalgebra R A) :
```
and throughout
done

```suggestion
    suffices x • b = b.mapRange (· * x) (by simp) from Finsupp.ext_iff.1 this j
```
Is this simp particularly slow? Why the `only`?
no, the `simp` is quite fast actually. I have removed the only

I think this is still true if S is just a set? `(includeLeft.comp S.val).range` would need to be changed to `includeLeft '' S` (which is defeq to `S.map includeLeft`, probably a better spelling).
And I believe the usual notation is this:
```suggestion
Let `R` be a commutative ring and `A, B` be `R`-algebras where `B` is free as `R`-module.
For any subset `S` of `A`, the centralizer of `S ⊆ A ⊗ B` is `C_A(S) ⊗ B` where `C_A(S)` is the
centralizer of `S` in `A`.
```

```suggestion
Let `R` be a commutative ring and `A, B` be `R`-algebras where `A` is free as `R`-module.
For any subset `S` of `B`, the centralizer of `S ⊆ A ⊗ B` is `A ⊗ C_B(S)` where `C_B(S)` is the
centralizer of `S` in `B`.
```
Also this simp?

You can use [Subalgebra.mulMap](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/LinearAlgebra/TensorProduct/Subalgebra.html#Subalgebra.mulMap), but maybe ⊤.val is not as desirable as `AlgHom.id R B`.
